intro: Paepalanthus monticola, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its yellow-orange inflorescence, which resembles a sunflower, and its ability to thrive in harsh, cold environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the extreme conditions of its mountainous habitat. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
